oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Promoting the Nutritional Value of Dairy Products
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilkinson, Marilyn
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nutrition
marketing
food industries
dairy industries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thank you for inviting me here today. You have asked me to do something I've been wanting to do for a long time-discuss the topic of promoting nutrition. First, I want to make it crystal clear-I am not a nutritionist. In fact, I am not in the scientific disciplines per se. I am a professional in the field of public relations-a piece of the marketing puzzle. And, as a key player in the dairy and food industries, I have many thoughts I want to share with you. A major point is simply this: Promoting nutrition is big business-and apparently getting bigger. Have you watched television lately? Looked at a cereal box? Read a newspaper? Americans are being bombarded by more and more promotional messages, and more and more of them have to do with nutrition ...
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1987; 42-46
